Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to prove that a Craigslist ad was soliciting "anti-Trump" protesters in Phoenix.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the provided photo of the Craigslist ad has been altered, with the word "Pro" swapped out for "Anti."
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the existence of the Craigslist ad by presenting it as a genuine solicitation when it is actually phony.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the ad is connected to a specific political event or campaign, without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim suggests that the ad may have been created to stoke anger from the other side of the aisle, implying an alternative explanation for its existence.
